paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: A Watermark for Large Language Models
candidates.reason: Core token-level baseline and z-test detector that SemStamp critiques, adapts (sentence-level z), and empirically surpasses.

candidates.title: Similarity estimation techniques from rounding algorithms
candidates.reason: Provides the cosine-preserving LSH/SimHash used to partition the sentence-embedding space.

candidates.title: Approximate Nearest Neighbor: Towards Removing the Curse of Dimensionality
candidates.reason: Foundational LSH framework enabling SemStamp’s semantic partitioning approach.

candidates.title: Paraphrastic Representations at Scale
candidates.reason: Supplies the contrastive paraphrase training used to make the encoder paraphrase-robust.

candidates.title: Sentence-BERT: Sentence Embeddings using Siamese BERT-Networks
candidates.reason: Base sentence encoder architecture for SemStamp.

candidates.title: COD3S: Diverse Generation with Discrete Semantic Signatures
candidates.reason: Closely related precedent conditioning generation on LSH signatures of sentence embeddings.

candidates.title: Online Generation of Locality Sensitive Hash Signatures
candidates.reason: Enables fast online LSH signature computation referenced by SemStamp.

candidates.title: PEGASUS: Pre-training with Extracted Gap-sentences for Abstractive Summarization
candidates.reason: Main paraphraser used for attacks and for training the encoder; central to the bigram paraphrase attack.

paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: BERTScore: Evaluating Text Generation with BERT
candidates.reason: Used to constrain paraphrase quality and evaluate similarity in the bigram paraphrase attack.

candidates.title: Paraphrasing evades detectors of AI-generated text
candidates.reason: but retrieval is an effective defense, Key motivation that paraphrases break token-level detection; informs attack design (e.g., Dipper).

candidates.title: Can AI-Generated Text be Reliably Detected?
candidates.reason: Provides the Parrot paraphraser and evidence of paraphrase-induced detection failures; used in experiments.

candidates.title: Robust Multi-bit Natural Language Watermarking through Invariant Features
candidates.reason: Prior work targeting robustness to corruption/edits; relevant conceptual baseline.

candidates.title: Watermarking Conditional Text Generation for AI Detection: Unveiling Challenges and a Semantic-Aware Watermark Remedy
candidates.reason: Incorporates semantic similarity into watermarking; conceptually adjacent to SemStamp’s semantic approach.

candidates.title: Provable Robust Watermarking for AI-Generated Text
candidates.reason: Contemporary robustness-oriented design; informs positioning and comparisons.

candidates.title: Robust Distortion-free Watermarks for Language Models
candidates.reason: Distribution-preserving watermarking; provides an alternative design to contrast with SemStamp.

candidates.title: On the Reliability of Watermarks for Large Language Models
candidates.reason: Documents fragility (esp. to paraphrase) of token-level schemes, bolstering SemStamp’s motivation.

paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: Undetectable Watermarks for Language Models
candidates.reason: Theoretical perspective on watermark detectability; situates SemStamp in the broader landscape.

candidates.title: Natural Language Watermarking: Design
candidates.reason: Analysis, and a Proof-of-Concept Implementation, Early NL watermarking work providing historical grounding.

candidates.title: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer
candidates.reason: Source of C4 RealNews data used for encoder training and watermark evaluation.

candidates.title: Watermarking Pre-trained Language Models with Backdooring
candidates.reason: Contrasting backdoor-based watermark paradigm; frames the design space.

candidates.title: A Private Watermark for Large Language Models
candidates.reason: Alternative generation/detection architecture (separate networks); relevant contrast to SemStamp’s public scheme.

candidates.title: Watermarking Text Data on Large Language Models for Dataset Copyright Protection
candidates.reason: Backdoor watermarks for copyright; related but orthogonal to SemStamp’s goal.

candidates.title: PromptCARE: Prompt Copyright Protection by Watermark Injection and Verification
candidates.reason: Adjacent watermarking on prompts rather than outputs.

candidates.title: Generating Sentences by Editing Prototypes
candidates.reason: Demonstrates LSH use for efficient similarity in generation; supports feasibility of LSH in text systems.

paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: Randomized Algorithms and NLP: Using Locality Sensitive Hash Functions for High Speed Noun Clustering
candidates.reason: Early NLP application of LSH; background for SemStamp’s LSH usage.

candidates.title: SimCSE: Simple Contrastive Learning of Sentence Embeddings
candidates.reason: Influences encoder training choices; general CL for sentence embeddings.

candidates.title: Dimensionality Reduction by Learning an Invariant Mapping
candidates.reason: Foundational contrastive learning principle underlying CL-based encoder robustness.

candidates.title: Self-Guided Contrastive Learning for BERT Sentence Representations
candidates.reason: Additional CL method for sentence embeddings; supportive background.

candidates.title: CERT: Contrastive Self-supervised Learning for Language Understanding
candidates.reason: CL variant informing sentence representation learning.

candidates.title: An efficient framework for learning sentence representations
candidates.reason: General sentence representation learning; background context.

candidates.title: Pair-Level Supervised Contrastive Learning for Natural Language Inference
candidates.reason: Supervised CL for sentences; supporting background.

candidates.title: SemEval-2017 Task 1: Semantic Textual Similarity Multilingual and Crosslingual Focused Evaluation
candidates.reason: Benchmark grounding SBERT’s similarity objective; motivates cosine-based embeddings.

paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: CoCo: Coherence-Enhanced Machine-Generated Text Detection Under Data Limitation With Contrastive Learning
candidates.reason: Post-hoc detection context; peripheral to in-generation watermarking.

candidates.title: DetectGPT: Zero-Shot Machine-Generated Text Detection using Probability Curvature
candidates.reason: Post-hoc detection baseline context; not used by SemStamp.

candidates.title: DetectLLM: Leveraging Log Rank Information for Zero-Shot Detection of Machine-Generated Text
candidates.reason: Post-hoc detection method; contextual background.

candidates.title: Automatic Detection of Generated Text is Easiest when Humans are Fooled
candidates.reason: Detection literature context; not directly used.

candidates.title: GLTR: Statistical Detection and Visualization of Generated Text
candidates.reason: Classic statistical detector; broader context only.

candidates.title: Defending Against Neural Fake News
candidates.reason: Classifier-based detection baseline; contextual.

candidates.title: Smaller Language Models are Better Black-box Machine-Generated Text Detectors
candidates.reason: Detector design context; peripheral.

candidates.title: Automatic Detection of Machine Generated Text: A Critical Survey
candidates.reason: Survey framing the detection landscape.

paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: Machine-Generated Text: A Comprehensive Survey of Threat Models and Detection Methods
candidates.reason: Broad survey background.

candidates.title: Release Strategies and the Social Impacts of Language Models
candidates.reason: High-level societal context; peripheral to the method.

candidates.title: Ethical and social risks of harm from Language Models
candidates.reason: Societal context; peripheral.

candidates.title: Threat Scenarios and Best Practices to Detect Neural Fake News
candidates.reason: Policy/practice context; peripheral.

candidates.title: Preventing Verbatim Memorization in Language Models Gives a False Sense of Privacy
candidates.reason: General LM privacy topic; tangential.

candidates.title: On the Possibilities of AI-Generated Text Detection
candidates.reason: Perspective piece; tangential to SemStamp’s technical contributions.

candidates.title: Neural Text Generation with Unlikelihood Training
candidates.reason: Cited for the Rep-3 repetition metric in evaluation only.

candidates.title: Generating Informative and Diverse Conversational Responses via Adversarial Information Maximization
candidates.reason: Source of the trigram entropy (Ent-3) diversity metric used in evaluation.

paperTitle: SemStamp: A Semantic Watermark with Paraphrastic Robustness for Text Generation

candidates.title: Contrastive Self-Supervised Learning for Commonsense Reasoning
candidates.reason: Ancillary contrastive learning reference; least directly connected.
